title: Drive-by shooting leaves 6 teens wounded at sweet sixteen party
content:
MIAMI-DADE (CBS12) — A birthday celebration in Miami went out with the wrong kind of bang, leaving a number of teenage guests with gunshot wounds. Three suspects were arrested on Wednesday in connection to the sweet sixteen shooting.
Miami-Dade Police charged 18-year-old Michael Melton, 18-year-old Dontavious Byrd, and 20-year-old Travonte Berry with Attempted Premeditated Murder with use of a deadly weapon.
Around 10 p.m. Saturday, teens were celebrating a sweet sixteen birthday party at a home located at 20582 southwest 119 Avenue. All was fun and games until suspect Melton approached one of the victims asking, "Are we gonna fight or shoot it out?"
Trying to avoid any confrontation, the victim walked away.
According to investigators, Melton, along with Byrd and Berry, then jumped into a car and began to shoot into the crowd.
Up to six minors were injured in the drive-by shooting. Their ages range from the youngest being just 12-years-old to the oldest being 17-years-old.
All of the injured teens were immediately taken to area hospitals - with four transported to Jackson South, one to Baptist Hospital in Kendall and the last airlifted to Kendall Regional. The six are in stable condition, and expected to be okay.
Police are asking for the communities help with their investigation. If you have any additional information about this shooting, please call Crime Stoppers at (305) 471-8477.
